content: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD): DSM-5 criteria require ≥5 symptoms for ≥2 weeks with functional impairment, including ≥1 of: (1) Depressed mood most of day, (2) Anhedonia (loss of interest/pleasure). Additional symptoms: weight/appetite change, insomnia/hypersomnia, psychomotor agitation/retardation, fatigue, worthlessness/guilt, decreased concentration, recurrent thoughts of death/suicidal ideation. Severity: mild (few symptoms, minor impairment), moderate, severe (many symptoms, major impairment), severe with psychotic features. PHQ-9 score: 5-9 mild, 10-14 moderate, 15-19 moderately severe, ≥20 severe. Suicidal risk assessment: MANDATO RY for all patients (ideation, plan, means, prior attempts). Treatment: psychotherapy (CBT), antidepressants (SSRI/SNRI first-line), ECT for severe/refractory. Hospitalization if acutely suicidal, psychotic, severe impairment.
name: Major Depressive Disorder - DSM-5 Criteria
